column5: Anyone have info on Orangeville ice?  Thanks,  Curt
you can call up to the island lake conservation area and they'll let you know.  I suspect there's not enough ice yet though.
whats in that lake anyways, it's a reservoir right?
Well ohhenrygsr, there are bass, pike, perch, crappie, bluegill and other assorted panfish.
Drove by there on Tuesday and couldn't see any huts on the ice yet.
I know that Earl Rowe park is just a bit north of Orangeville, but does anyone know if the ice conditions are good on that pond?

you cant fish the earl rowe pond it is closed season and there are rainbow, salmon, carp (small), bass, (very few crappie but i have caught them there) sunfish, rock bass, catfish(very small) it is froze over good but not for fishing

what's your target fish?  they would appreciate you taking a pike or two if you're in .  small perch,, a few decent crappy and a few bluegills are possible.if you get good ice they are usually pretty  good with info at the desk about where and how. there's bait as well.
